description:
Optimistic Hiori can’t turn away anyone in need. Awkward Ruka can’t seem to make friends, even when she tries. But these two do have one thing in common: they’re both magical girls called Reflectors! Together, this unlikely pair will use their powers to help resolve emotional struggles and protect the Fragments of people’s hearts.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Tragedy

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Amnesia

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mellco)

Illustrator mainly for light novels who first debuted in 2004.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

**[Website](https://exina.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/EXiNA_XiENA)** | **[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/exinaofficial/)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/shiena-nishizawa/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/exina_xiena/)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKUR1GWKBZbFByLoPeRxDtA)** | **[Artist Page (Flying Dog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A024998.html)**

**Introduction:**
Shiena Nishizawa, alternatively known by stage name EXiNA, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer. She debuted under record label flying DOG after winning the grand prize at the label's first audition, she is now under record label [SACRA MUSIC](http://sacramusic.jp/artist/) (which is under Sony Music Entertainment).

**Biography:**
In junior high school, she became immersed in music when she received her father's guitar as a gift. She dreamed that one that she would sing in front of a large number of people as an artist, and in 2014 she won the grand prize at the "First flying DOG Audition". In 2015 she performed the ending theme song to the TV anime *"[Kantai Collection: Kancolle](https://anilist.co/anime/20553/Kantai-Collection-KanColle)"*, which was also her debut as a musician. 

Shiena announed a solo project on July 9, 2019, going from using her real name Shiena Nishizawa to adopting a new stage name EXiNA (which is an anagram of her given name Shiena = EXiNA). Her first release as EXiNA was a digital single released on July 10, 2019 titled 'EQ'. She went on to release a second digital single on August 3, 2019 titled 'KATANA', and then followed-up by releasing her third single on August 14, 2019 titled 'OVERTHINKING BOY'. Her first mini-album was released on August 21, 2019 titled 'XiX', which was also her first album-like release under her new stage name.

(Source: [generasia.com](http://www.generasia.com/wiki/Nishizawa_Shiena) | [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%A5%BF%E6%B2%A2%E5%B9%B8%E5%A5%8F), edited)

A new generation artist "ACCAMER" who goes back and forth between 2D and 3D with a powerful singing voice. With the charm of that singing voice, she made her debut as an artist after being selected as the opening theme song for the TV anime "LISTENERS"
**Hiroyuki Aoi** is a Japanese producer and publicity manager.
__Yasuhira Sakai__ is a Japanese music producer.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Official Website ](https://www.aoieir.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/eir_ruru) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ7B1oCEDT_d4c9XTtChX7w) | [Instagram ](https://www.instagram.com/aoieir/) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/18moNotPmBWa2YZtRnIoZ3?autoplay=true)

Aoi Eir is a Japanese pop singer signed to SME Records. She was discovered through Nico Nico Douga video sharing network. Like other Nico Nico Douga artists, not much of her personal information is revealed.   

Eir has loved singing since she was a child, at high school period, she sung in a band she had formed. After graduating from high school, she gave up her music career but continued performing publicly. Her impressive and beautiful voice are easily recognizable and she has been selected to sing the closing song for TV animation “Fate/Zero” which was released as her debut single called “MEMORIA” on October 19, 2011.

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.
